author: yorickdowne
content:
Oh hi. I wanted to comment on Prague/Electra from a node operator/staking perspective, and the discussion of what "big thing" might go into it.
Having slept on this, I vastly prefer EOF over 4444.
Whichever of them doesn't make it in, is 2026 at the earliest. Verkle 2025 unless it pushes into 2026.
4TB drives are affordable now (MP34) and more so in 2025, when 2TB may no longer be sufficient. Node Operators can deal with the expense.
EOF unlocks better smart contracts, that make it easier to reason about security among other benefits (code/data separation). 2 years in the software dev space matters

I'd rather see the app/user layer getting a boost than the staker layer. Because that ultimately brings value to ETH, and that's good for stakers as well.

author: kolbyml
content:
A quick TL:DR of (what is)/(the status of) the Portal Networks*
Portal is a project comprised of different P2P networks history, beacon (stores Beacon Chain state used to validate data for other portal network's post merge), state... State is WIP/R&D. But history is currently in the bug fixing stage. With beacon almost out of the implementation stage. History will provide pre-merge blocks, History + Beacon will provide all minus 8192 blocks at first, then all blocks after a network upgrade. The idea being all data should be validatable. Once the bugs are squashed we will launch a Portal History network for 4444's.
